articles.author: Ben Dooley
articles.title: Carlos Ghosn Left Home Alone, Japanese Media Reports, as Mystery Lingers
articles.description: Security cameras mounted outside the fallen auto titan’s house showed him walking out, local outlets said, citing anonymous officials.
articles.content: The full story of how Mr. Ghosn left Tokyo and wound up in Lebanon remains a mystery. News media in Lebanon and Turkey have reported that he flew out of Osaka, Japan, which is roughly 300 miles from Tokyo, and then flew to Turkey before arriving in Lebanon. T… [+1188 chars]

articles.author: Mark Landler
articles.title: A ‘Sir’ With Blue-Collar Roots: Britain’s Labour Race Has an Unlikely Leader
articles.description: A party that lost many of its working-class voters in last month’s election may turn, unexpectedly, to a London lawyer to be its next leader, an early poll shows.
articles.content: Theres been a lot of talk about Labour needing a leader from the north or a candidate who is identifiably working class, but that doesnt seem to be the case, said Tim Bale, a professor of politics at Queen Mary University who directed the poll for YouGov, alo… [+1634 chars]

articles.author: Richard Flanagan
articles.title: Australia Is Committing Climate Suicide
articles.description: As record fires rage, the country’s leaders seem intent on sending it to its doom.
articles.content:
All this, and peak fire season is only just beginning.

articles.author: Alexandra Stevenson
articles.title: Oil Prices Jump After Top Iranian Is Killed on U.S. Orders
articles.description: Analysts warned that the strike on an Iranian military leader raises the prospect of volatility within Iran and Iraq, two major oil producers.
articles.content:
HONG KONG Oil prices jumped early Friday in Asia on news that a powerful Iranian military leader was killed in a strike authorized by the United States, ratcheting up geopolitical tensions and threatening to disrupt world access to oil supplies.
